item.title: All of us are embedded in our own safe “reality”
item.description: All of us are embedded in our own safe “reality,” shaping what we see and know in ways of which we are completely unaware. Many circumstances conspire to extinguish scientific discoveries, especially those that cause discomfort about our culture’s sacred norms. As a species, we cling to the familiar, comforting conformities of the mainstream.

item.title: A social construct doesn’t mean it’s not real
item.description: Our “real” experiences, symptoms, and syndromes—individually or collectively—can be mental as well as physical. The subtext of these critiques is that PMS is “socially constructed,” meaning it’s an imaginary condition foisted on women by society, which is another way of saying PMS is “not real.
